text: I think there's a level of stress that
comes from having a phone that is
connected to everything at all time
I mean screens in general affect the way
that we sleep if you're looking at your
screen right before bed I mean often
scientists or doctors will even say like
try and you know read a book instead or
the last hour before you sleep put away
your phone because the blue light from
your phone is actually stimulating your
brain thinking okay it's daylight I
should be awake so put it away a little
earlier and you'll probably get a better
sleep I think on top of that just like
the idea that we're so connected to our
phone if it's buzzing if you don't have
it on silent mode if you're able to
think about like all your work emails
are attached to that or all your tweets
are coming through there I think there's
a level of stress that comes from having
a phone that is connected to everything
at all times and so maybe even just like
put it somewhere you can't totally reach
when you're going to bed also when we
were doing some sleep research this is I
don't think unfounded in any science but
it was a really interesting tactic when
you're getting up at night don't look at
the time
because when you look at the time you
start to go oh we have to get up in like
an hour
damn it then you start to actually
consider yourself awake and so what you
do is you just don't look it and I've
actually used that type of guide dog or
the time when I got up at night and I
fall back to sleep immediately so maybe
it's just anecdotal but I don't look at
my smartphone to look at the time and
whatever whatever like I quit
